definition: like a fish back in water (idiom); glad to be back in one's proper surroundings
as/as if/such as
fish/CL:條|条[tiao2],尾[wei3]
surname Yu
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: Of course, RAND hasn’t exactly abandoned its bread-and-butter services.
sentences.chinese: 當然，蘭德並沒有放棄它如魚得水的項目。

sentences.english: I feel just like a fish in water.
sentences.chinese: 我在北京簡直就是如魚得水。

sentences.english: Crony capitalism, on both sides of the Pacific, it appears, has its rewards.
sentences.chinese: 看來，權貴資本主義在太平洋兩岸都是如魚得水。

sentences.english: Their social adeptness makes it simple for the social butterflies to be quite at home in large group settings.
sentences.chinese: 自如的社交能力讓交際花們在大型聚會上如魚得水。

definition: handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
able and efficient
lit. to squander money like dirt (idiom)/fig. to spend money like water/extravagant
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
to live like a prince (idiom)
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
outstanding talent (idiom); incomparable artistic merit
young and promising
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
entertainment world/show business
changeable situation (idiom)
selfless/impartial
to be chivalrous
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
